conclusion: The problem involves a suitcase being pulled with an oblique upward force to achieve uniform motion on a horizontal surface.
The total mass of the suitcase is 15 kg, gravitational acceleration is 10 m/s², and the minimum pull force is 90 N.
The resistance of the suitcase to the ground is proportional to the supporting force of the ground, with a ratio of μ.
The image shows a suitcase with wheels and a handle.

premise: Given m = 15 kg and g = 10 m/s².
conclusion: The gravitational force (weight) on the suitcase is W = mg = 150 N.
The pulling force F is 90 N and makes an angle θ with the horizontal.
The normal force N is the force exerted by the ground on the suitcase, perpendicular to the surface.
The frictional force f opposes the motion and is proportional to the normal force, given by f = μN.

premise: In the vertical direction, forces must balance: N + F sin(θ) = W.
In the horizontal direction, forces must balance: F cos(θ) = f.
Substitute N from the vertical equation into the horizontal equation.

conclusion: Substitute these values into the equation: 90 × 0.8 = μ (150 - 54).
The values of μ and θ are determined.
